org.nzdis.micro

Class MTConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nzdis.micro.constants.PlatformConstants
      • org.nzdis.micro.messaging.MTRuntime
        • org.nzdis.micro.MTConnector

  • public class MTConnector
extends MTRuntime
    The MTConnector (or MessageTransportConnector) links the agent implementation with the message passing framework sending side. It handles registration, sending of goal messages and events transparently using the underlying messaging framework. Not actual message passing is involved in this class but rather filtering invalid messages as well as directing messages containing goals and events.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.0 $ $Date: 2013/03/01 00:00:00 $
    Author:
    Christopher Frantz

      • send

        public static void send(MicroMessage message)
        Sends a message to the recipient based on either recipient field, else by automatic determining the recipient(s) based on intent or event objects. Semantics of the filtering process: If message recipient is supplied the message is directed to this, independent from further fields. If message contains a intent, the first agent holding a role for which the intent is applicable will be addressed. If message contains an event, the message is further filtered on the related performative for subscription (SUBSCRIBE), desubscription (UNSUBSCRIBE) from this specific event class, clearing of all subscriptions (CLEAR_SUBSCRIPTIONS) for the sender (independent from event class passed). If those performatives do not match the event is considered to be raised and all subscribed agents are notified.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to be sent

      • sendToPlatform

        public static void sendToPlatform(java.lang.String platformID,
                                  MicroMessage message)
        Sends a message to a remote platform agent of a platform identified via the (runtime) platform ID. Be aware that this ID changes with every restart of a platform. An alternative is sendToPlatform(SocketAddress, MicroMessage).
        Parameters:
        platformID - Current platform ID
        message - MicroMessage to be sent to platform agent

                                  MicroMessage message)
        Sends message to platform identified via network address.
        Parameters:
        address - SocketAddress identifying network address
        message - MicroMessage to be sent to platform agent of the according platform

      • sendRandomcast

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sendRandomcast(MicroMessage message,
                                                                   java.lang.Integer numberOfTargets,
                                                                   boolean global,
                                                                   boolean trueIndicatesListofCandidatesFalseIndicatesExcludedAgents,
                                                                   java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> inOrExclusionList)
        Sends RandomCast to randomly chosen, constrained by further parameters (mostly in/exclusion list). If global is set to true, includes all connected remote nodes. Should only be called by an agent, not externally. Will return an error message to the sender if not sufficient targets are available.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to be sent
        numberOfTargets - Number of target agents
        global - Boolean indicator if platforms should be global
        trueIndicatesListofCandidatesFalseIndicatesExcludedAgents - true indicates to use the exOrInclusionList as list for candidate agents, false indicates agents that are excluded from random choice
        inOrExclusionList - ArrayList of agents (agent names) to be excluded from Randomcast. If null, all platform-registered agents can be potentially selected.
        Returns:
        List of agents that have been chosen by the system as message recipient (or empty list)

      • sendFuzzycast

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sendFuzzycast(MicroMessage message,
                                                                  java.lang.Float quota,
                                                                  boolean global,
                                                                  boolean trueIndicatesListofCandidatesFalseIndicatesExcludedAgents,
                                                                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> inOrExclusionList)
        Sends FuzzyCast to of registered or specified agents - constrained by further parameters (mostly in/exclusion list). If global is set to true, includes all connected remote nodes. Should only be called by an agent, not externally. Will return an error message to the sender if not sufficient targets are available.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to be sent
        quota - Quota of agents to be addressed (either from registered agents, or agents provided in inclusion list (see further parameters))
        global - Boolean indicator if platforms should be global
        trueIndicatesListofCandidatesFalseIndicatesExcludedAgents - true indicates to use the exOrInclusionList as list for candidate agents, false indicates agents that are excluded from random choice
        inOrExclusionList - ArrayList of agents (agent names) to be excluded from Randomcast. If null, all platform-registered agents can be potentially selected.
        Returns:
        List of agents that have been chosen by the system as message recipient (or empty list)

      • getRandomAgents

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRandomAgents(int numberOfTargets,
                                                               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> exclusionList,
                                                               boolean global,
                                                               boolean allowLessTargets)
        Returns random registered agents, optionally allows inclusion of agents from other connected platforms.
        Parameters:
        numberOfTargets - Number of agents to be returned
        exclusionList - List of agents that should be excluded from random selection (or null if none to be excluded)
        global - Indicator if agents on other platforms should be considered for random selection
        allowLessTargets - Indicates if returning less than requested number of agents is permissible. If not, it returns empty list if insufficient agents available.
        Returns:
        List of randomly chosen agents

      • getRandomAgentsFromList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRandomAgentsFromList(int numberOfTargets,
                                                                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> inclusionList)
        Returns randomly picked agents from list of given agents. Checks for agents' registration prior to picking. Returns exactly the requested number of agents (numberOfTargets) or none.
        Parameters:
        numberOfTargets - Number of targets to be picked
        inclusionList - List from which agents are to be picked
        Returns:
        List of randomly chosen agents; returns empty list if too little agents available in candidate list for picking.

      • getRandomAgentsFromList

                                                                       boolean allowLessTargets)
        Returns randomly picked agents from list of given agents. Checks for agents' registration prior to picking.
        Parameters:
        numberOfTargets - Number of targets to be picked
        inclusionList - List from which agents are to be picked
        allowLessTargets - Indicates if returning less than requested number of agents is permissible. If not, it returns empty list if insufficient agents available.
        Returns:
        List of randomly chosen agents; returns empty list if too little agents available in candidate list for picking.

      • sendRolecast

        public static void sendRolecast(MicroMessage message,
                                Role role,
                                boolean global)
        Sends role cast (message to all agents with a given role). If global = true, all connected nodes are contacted as well. Deliver is based on role class, not role instance, e.g. all TestRole() instances.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to be sent
        role - Role type the message to be sent to
        global - Indicates if roles on other platforms should be notified

      • validateMessage

        Validates the MicroMessage with the MicroMessage validator defined in the configuration file. (if validation is activated)
        Parameters:
        message - Message to check
        Returns:
        Boolean indicator if message is valid (true) or not (false)

      • notifySender

        public static void notifySender(MicroMessage message,
                                java.lang.String messageType,
                                int type,
                                boolean print,
                                boolean sendLocally)
        Sends message to sending agent in case of distribution problems. Types of problems --> 1, recipient agent not registered locally 2, recipient agent neither registered locally nor globally 3, intent processor could not be found (if no recipient supplied) 4, intent forwarded to remote host for execution 5, inform sender about blind forwarding to remote host (not error but information) 6, specified remote platform not connected with local one 7, intent processor could not be found on this platform (intent request from other platform) 8, invalid GenericIntent provided 9, execution error for GenericIntent 10, not enough agents available for RandomCast (either too many excluded or not enough registered) 11, invalid quota passed for FuzzyCast (values < 0 or > 1)
        Parameters:
        message - Message of concern for delivery
        messageType - Either ERROR_MESSAGE or INFORM_MESSAGE constant
        type - Notification type (see above)
        print - Indicates if message should be printed in console
        sendLocally - Indicates if the notification should be sent to the original message sender

      • printApplicableIntents

        public static void printApplicableIntents()
        Prints all registered applicable intents.

        public static void shutdown()
        Initializes the shutdown of the platform and ensures that all agents, role assignments, intents and events are removed.

      • shutdownCheck

        public static boolean shutdownCheck()
        Checks the key data structures and indicates if those have been unloaded for system consistency.
        Returns:
        boolean true indicates that everything is unloaded

      • getCurrentTime

        public static java.util.Date getCurrentTime()
        Returns the current time as Date object.
        Returns:
        Current time as Date object

      • getCurrentTimeString

        public static java.lang.String getCurrentTimeString(boolean includingDate)
        Returns the formatted current date/time as String (for output/logging purposes) supported formats: "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss", "HH:mm:ss" (see constants DATE_FORMAT_NOW and TIME_FORMAT_NOW).
        Parameters:
        includingDate - Boolean indicating if date should be returned or only time
        Returns:
        String representation of current time

      • validateGenericIntent

        public static boolean validateGenericIntent(Intent intent)
        Validates a generic intent with regards to specification in GenericIntentProcessor.
        Parameters:
        intent - Generic intent to be validated
        Returns:
        Boolean indicating if validation was successful
